Science!  thou fair effusive ray</br>From the great source of mental Day,</br>Free, generous, and refin'd!</br>Descend with all thy treasures fraught,</br>Illumine each bewilder'd thought,</br>And bless my lab'ring mind.

But first with thy resistless light,</br>Disperse those phantoms from my sight,</br>Those mimic shades of thee;</br>The scholiast's learning, sophist's cant,</br>The visionary bigot's rant,</br>The monk's philosophy.

O!  let thy powerful charms impart</br>The patient head, the candid heart,</br>Devoted to thy sway;</br>Which no weak passions e'er mislead,</br>Which still with dauntless steps proceed</br>Where Reason points the way.

Give me to learn each secret cause;</br>Let number's, figure's, motion's laws</br>Reveal'd before me stand;</br>These to great Nature's scenes apply,</br>And round the globe, and thro' the sky,</br>Disclose her working hand.

Next, to thy nobler search resign'd,</br>The busy, restless, human mind</br>Thro' ev'ry maze pursue;</br>Detect Perception where it lies,</br>Catch the ideas as they rise,</br>And all their changes view.

Say from what simple springs began</br>The vast, ambitious thoughts of man,</br>Which range beyond controul;</br>Which seek Eternity to trace,</br>Dive thro' th' infinity of space,</br>And strain to grasp THE WHOLE.

Her secret stores let Memory tell,</br>Bid Fancy quit her fairy cell,</br>In all her colours drest;</br>While prompt her sallies to controul,</br>Reason, the judge, recalls the soul</br>To Truth's severest test.

Then launch thro' Being's wide extent;</br>Let the fair scale, with just ascent,</br>And cautious steps, be trod;</br>And from the dead, corporeal mass,</br>Thro' each progressive order pass</br>To Instinct, Reason, GOD.

There, Science!  veil thy daring eye;</br>Nor dive too deep, nor soar too high,</br>In that divine abyss;</br>To Faith content thy beams to lend,</br>Her hopes t' assure, her steps befriend,</br>And light her way to bliss.

Then downwards take thy flight agen,</br>Mix with the policies of men,</br>And social nature's ties:</br>The plan, the genius of each state,</br>Its interest and its pow'rs relate,</br>It fortunes and its rise.

Thro' private life pursue thy course,</br>Trace every action to its source,</br>And means and motives weigh:</br>Put tempers, passions in the scale,</br>Mark what degrees in each prevail,</br>And fix the doubtful sway.

That last, best effort of thy skill,</br>To form the life, and rule the will,</br>Propitious pow'r!  impart:</br>Teach me to cool my passion's fires,</br>Make me the judge of my desires,</br>The master of my heart.

Raise me above the vulgar's breath,</br>Pursuit of fortune, fear of death,</br>And all in life that's mean.</br>Still true to reason be my plan,</br>Still let my action speak the man,</br>Thro' every various scene.

Hail!  queen of manners, light of truth;</br>Hail!  charm of age, and guide of youth;</br>Sweet refuge of distress:</br>In business, thou!  exact, polite;</br>Thou giv'st Retirement its delight,</br>Prosperity its grace.

Of wealth, pow'r, freedom, thou!  the cause;</br>Foundress of order, cities, laws,</br>Of arts inventress, thou!</br>Without thee what were human kind?</br>How vast their wants, their thoughts how blind!</br>Their joys how mean!  how few!

Sun of the soul!  thy beams unveil!</br>Let others spread the daring sail,</br>On Fortune's faithless sea;</br>While undeluded, happier I</br>From the vain tumult timely fly,</br>And sit in peace with Thee.</br>
